Launched in July 2021, the Avalanche Bridge is the most popular Ethereum-connected bridge by TVL, exceeding $6B as of today. It has been used for over 243k transactions to allow more than $43B in ERC-20 assets on Ethereum to be used on Avalanche.
The Avalanche Bridge has become a cornerstone piece of infrastructure for the community, and now Bitcoin holders will be able to securely and efficiently transfer their BTC onto #Avalanche

The best-in-class #AvalancheBridge is expanding native support for the Bitcoin network, bringing a trillion dollar asset class to access the exploding DeFi ecosystem on #Avalanche 
https://t.co/MnNWVgY86v

Headlining the innovations built into Core is native bridging functionality, which enables users to directly access the #AvalancheBridge. This is a first-of-its-kind feature for a browser extension wallet, which will help expand access to #Avalanche from users across Web3.
The first phase will be the Core browser extension, expected to arrive in late March. The second phase, launching the Core mobile application, is expected to follow in early Q2.

Announcing the launch of Core, a high-powered, non-custodial wallet engineered specifically for apps on #Avalanche, including subnets and next gen Web3 projects.

Developed by @avalabsofficial, Core will include both a mobile wallet and browser extension.
